results.title: "Nihilism" of chronic heart failure therapy in children and why effective therapy is withheld
results.text_hl: At our institution, @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Spironolactone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013148 @@@spironolactone@@@ have been firmly established to treat systolic @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@cHF@@@, @DISEASE_Hypoplastic_Left_Heart_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D018636 @@@hypoplastic left heart syndrome@@@ (@DISEASE_Hypoplastic_Left_Heart_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D018636 @@@HLHS@@@) following hybrid approach and congenital left-right @<m>DISEASE_Hyperbilirubinemia_Shunt</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C562451 @@@shunt@@@ diseases, latest in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ where surgery has to be delayed.

citations.NLM: Schranz D, Voelkel NF. "Nihilism" of chronic heart failure therapy in children and why effective therapy is withheld Eur J Pediatr. 2016 Apr;175(4):445-55. PMID: 26895877
